org.beancp

Interface Mapper

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MappingInfo

    public interface Mapper
extends MappingInfo
    Object to object mapper. Implementation must be thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <S,D> D map(S source, Class<D> destinationClass)
      Constructs destination object and copies data from source object to newly created destination object.
      <S,D> void map(S source, D destination)
      Copies data from source object to destination object.
      <S,D> Optional<D> mapIfMapperAvailable(S source, Class<D> destinationClass)
      Constructs destination object and copies data from source object to newly created destination object.
      <S,D> boolean mapIfMapperAvailable(S source, D destination)
      Copies data from source object to destination object.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.beancp.MappingInfo

        isConverterAvailable, isMapAvailable

    • Method Detail

      • map

        <S,D> void map(S source,
               D destination)
        throws MappingException
        Copies data from source object to destination object. When the are more than one mapper valid for source and destination classes then mapper is chose according to priority (first option has highest priority):
        1. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        2. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        3. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        4. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        5. convention defined by MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
        When there is more than one mapper of the same priority then is used the first one added to MapperBuilder. If no mapper available then MappingException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        S - source object class.
        D - destination object class.
        Parameters:
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        Throws:
        MappingException

      • mapIfMapperAvailable

        <S,D> boolean mapIfMapperAvailable(S source,
                                   D destination)
                            throws MappingException
        Copies data from source object to destination object. When the are more than one mapper valid for source and destination classes then mapper is chose according to priority (first option has highest priority):
        1. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        2. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        3. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        4. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        5. convention defined by MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
        When there is more than one mapper of the same priority then is used the first one added to MapperBuilder. If no mapper available then will return false{code}, otherwise return true{code}.
        Type Parameters:
        S - source object class.
        D - destination object class.
        Parameters:
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        Returns:
        false{code} if no mapper available, otherwise true{code}.
        Throws:
        MappingException

      • map

        <S,D> D map(S source,
            Class<D> destinationClass)
     throws MappingException
        Constructs destination object and copies data from source object to newly created destination object. Destination object is created by destination object builder defined by Map.constructDestinationObjectUsing(java.util.function.Supplier) or if destination object builder is not available by default constructor. When the are more than one mapper valid for source and destination classes then mapper is chose according to priority (first option has highest priority):
        1. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        2. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        3. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        4. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        5. convention defined by MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
        When there is more than one mapper of the same priority then is used the first one added to MapperBuilder. If no mapper available then MappingException will be thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        S - source object class.
        D - destination object class.
        Parameters:
        source - source object.
        destinationClass - destination object class.
        Returns:
        destination object.
        Throws:
        MappingException

      • mapIfMapperAvailable

        <S,D> Optional<D> mapIfMapperAvailable(S source,
                                       Class<D> destinationClass)
                                throws MappingException
        Constructs destination object and copies data from source object to newly created destination object. Destination object is created by destination object builder defined by Map.constructDestinationObjectUsing(java.util.function.Supplier) or if destination object builder is not available by default constructor. When the are more than one mapper valid for source and destination classes then mapper is chose according to priority (first option has highest priority):
        1. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        2. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class equals to mapper destination class
        3. source class equals to mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        4. source class inherits from mapper source class and destination class inherits from mapper destination class
        5. convention defined by MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
        When there is more than one mapper of the same priority then is used the first one added to MapperBuilder.
        Type Parameters:
        S - source object class.
        D - destination object class.
        Parameters:
        source - source object.
        destinationClass - destination object class.
        Returns:
        destination object if no mapper is available, otherwise empty optional object.
        Throws:
        MappingException
